abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Road
            Rehabilitation Credit Project are as follows: overall
            outcome of the project was rated satisfactory, and the
            performance of the Bank and the Borrower were rated highly
            satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from the project
            are: (a) the infrastructure sector is a crucial link
            determining the country's ability to respond to high
            risk natural shocks. Ensuring appropriate standards and
            sustainable management of infrastructure are important
            priorities for the Government, and warrants continued
            engagement of International Development Association (IDA) in
            the sector with these objectives; (b) the contribution to
            institutional strengthening under the project was
            significant, as it strengthened dialogue, provided a basis
            for improving business processes and restructuring, and
            developed a foundation for infrastructure asset management
            that will support the sustainability of the project works;
            (c) the most appropriate framework for effective
            participation of the private sector in the provision of
            infrastructure services needs to be found for Samoa, which
            is limited by a thin market. The selective use of
            joint-venture arrangements, the use of small to-moderate
            package sizes, improved procurement procedures, and careful
            detailing of financial requirements need to be tailored so
            as to develop the enabling environment further for national
            and regional firms; and (d) the protection of infrastructure
            in coastal areas involves a range of "hard" and
            "soft" solutions which need to be designed to
            harmonize with coastal processes and with social and
            cultural preferences. There is a need to assess and manage
            coastal hazards more strategically, and to involve the
            communities and landowners in reaching comprehensive and
            cost-effective solutions which are also socially and
            environmentally sustainable.
